characters: AT THE OTHER END OF THE CATWALK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Illegal Costa Rican parasail operator ENRIQUE CARDOSO hel Americans BEN HILDEBRAND and twelve-year-old ERIC KIRVY - already wearing life-vests -- strap themselves into a two person PARASAIL HARNESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and Eric clamber onto a makeshift PLATFORM that hangs the back of the board. Dangling from Ben's neck is a CAMC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You make sure to get us as close as you can, okay? If it's a good trip, I'll give you a  little extra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. I take you close. But not too  close. (rubbing Eric's head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want them to eat you. Enrique heads toward the driver's seat and a large SECOND WINCH bolted to the deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready, amigos? Ben and Eric nod excitedly and give the thumbs up. Ben li camcorder to the record the action. Enrique jams the down the throttle down, and with a loud speedboat shoots forward. Soon the boat is whipping acros rolling ocean. Strapped together, Ben and Eric lean back over the passin water, intently watching for Enrique's signal. As the boat picks up speed, Enrique eyes the speedometer. Ben grabs the end of the RIPCORD attached to the harness. Eric braces themselves. Enrique finally signals with a pulling motion. He pulls the winch, Ben yanks the cord and -  WOOOSH! A brightly colored PARASAIL blossoms behind the b hoisting Ben and Eric aloft. In a big BLOCK LETTERS on th parasail is stitched "DINO-SOAR." THE TOWNLINE unsold rapidly from its enormous reel. BEN AND ERIC climb higher and higher. ENRIQUE keeps an eye on the clients. When they reach a ce height, he LOCKS OFF the reel. High overhead, Ben and Eric are floating in wonderful, qu splendor. The motor of the boat now sounds strangely dist Down below, the boat enters a think blanket of FOG. Eric points excitedly at the islands as Ben films him wit camera. Then, a sudden TUG on the thing line cause Ben to drop th which now dangles from his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that? A second tug...and now the faintest of screams. Ben and Eric look down to find that the boat has disappea into the low bank of FOG. By the time the boat emerges on the far side of the mist. IS NO SIGN OF ENRIQUE. The deck is splattered with blood. As Ben considers the driverless boat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben! Ben glances over at Eric, staring in horror at something  below. Following his gaze, Ben finds that their boat is o moments away from crashing into A LARGE REEF. Sticking out of the water, the imposing reef is being bat by waves. AS THE BOAT SMASHES INTO THE REEF, it splinters into a number of pieces. A panicked Ben turns to Eric.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unclip your line! Eric and Ben frantically unclip their lines. Catching an updraft, the parasailers float upward. A strong wind sends them wafting over the daunting cliffs of ISLA SORNA...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO PLASTIC DINOSAURS enter the frame and do battle accom by a child's ferocious sounds.

dialogues.speaker: WINDER TO REVEAL -
dialogues.text: CHARLIE, a three-year old boy, plays in a sandbox with hi favorite toy dinosaurs. ALAN GRANT squats next to him and watches with great delight. ELLIE SATLER stands over them, an INFANT in her arms -- a picture of the perfect family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, actually, Charlie, those two are herbivores. They wouldn't be interested in fighting each other. But these... (picking up two other dinosaurs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, these are carnivores. And this one here -- see its claws -- this one here uses its claws to gouge at the throat of its opponent… As Grant demonstrates with some GRUNT and GROANS of his own, he only succeeds in frightening the boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Alan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's three. Why don't you wait till he's a little older?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, right. (back to Charlie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy dinosaurs. He bounces them along the sandbox edge. Then, the sound of a CAR ENGINE turning off and a door SLAMMING is heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That must be Mark. (calling out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark, we’re back here! Ellie and Grant turn to see -- MARK DEGLER coming through the gate carrying a briefcase. balance demeanor. He and Ellie kiss tenderly on the lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keeping the world safe. (re: baby)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, let me take her. Ellie hands off the baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark, this is Alan Grant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you, Alan. I've heard a lot about you. The two men shake hands, and we now realize it is Grant who is the stranger in this household. Little Charlie run his father, showing his dinosaur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, this is a herbabore. Grant smiles uncomfortably, a third wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WINDEN to a PARROT in a large cage. Grant is teasing  the bird with a cookie, holding a it just out of reach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's my name? Come on, Jack, say it. Is my name Alan? Say my name. The bird doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He used to know me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Alan it's been six years. Grant shrugs, gives Jack the cookie, and heads towards th The three adults are finishing their dessert and coffee. The children have been out to bed. An awkward moment of silence. Uncomfortable smiles. Then

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relived)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Great. Mark stands and collects their cups.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Mark's working at the State Department now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?  (To Mark) What do you do there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with mock bravado)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could tell you about it, but than I'd have to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indeed. Mark smiles, nodding. Then he goes into the kitchen. Anot uncomfortable silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are you working on now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a new site in Montana. At least until the money runs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raptors, mostly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My favorite. Grant leans forward, realizing Ellie's one of the few peo can talk to about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember the sounds they made?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I try not to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've done cranial scans, and raptors actually had a quite sophisticated resonating chamber. I have a theory that their ability to vocalize is the key to their social intelligence. The way they can work together as a team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think they could talk to each other?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To a degree we never imagined. And from the cage in the corner of the room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit! Both look back at the parrot. ELLIE smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You taught him that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie and Grant head toward the rental car parked in the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck with the fund raising.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was never easy, but before Jurassic Park, you could find money. Somewhere. Now fossils are out. Everyone wants to see a real live dinosaur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Times change Alan. But you're the still the best. I mean that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last of my breed. A long moment passes between them as both consider where they've ended up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd better get going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me know if I can help, Alan. You’re bad about asking for help, but please ask me. Anything, anytime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deep down knowing he never will)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Goodbye, Ellie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Alan. Not sure what the right thing to do is, they finally end a friendly hug. They keep it short. Grant gets in his car. Starts the ENGINE. He's about to pull off when Ellie knocks on the window. H it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I met you, I thought that one day millions of years ago, all the dinosaurs became extinct. Wiped out. But you told me otherwise. When conditions changed, dinosaurs changed. They became other things. They evolved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A well-accepted theory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (simply)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan don't be afraid to evolve. Grant hears her, but Ellie knows it didn't really get thr A forced half-smile, than Grant waves goodbye. Ellie watches as he drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last stop on Grant's fund-raising tour, it's a public lecture hosted by some foundation. There are SCIENTISTS a STUDENTS here, but also a lot of DINO-FANS, some even wit costumes. Grant finishes his speech to what was a full house -- som ATTENDEES are grabbing their coats and sneaking out. This wasn't the exciting guest speaker they were all expecting A new slide comes up. Just black and white, and indeciphe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's through the painstaking study of the Interior chamber in multiple specimens that we can determine this exciting correlation between the larynx and the upper plate. That lets us theorize -- theorize, mind you -- that the raptor might have been capable of bird- like vocalizations. Which as you can imagine, would be a tremendous breakthrough. He's finished, but no one seems to notice at first. Then SYMPOSTUM LEADER stands up, leading a smattering round of APPLAUSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you very much Dr. Grant. Now does anyone have a question? Nearly every hand goes up. Grant doesn't seem surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does anyone have a question that doesn't  relate to Jurassic Park? Quite a few hands go down. GRANT (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or the incident in San Diego, which I'll remind you, I did not witness. Now most of the hands are down. Picking one of the few remaining...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your theory on raptors is good and all, but isn't all this conjecture kind of moot? The STUDENT'S BUDDY nods in agreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, once the U.N. and Costa Rica and everyone decides how to handle the second island, scientist will just go in and look for themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't paleontology itself in danger of extinction? Recognizing those as fighting words, the symposium leader about to step in. But Grant will take this himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, and let me be perfectly clear on this point. Dinosaurs lived 65 million years ago. What's left of them is fossilized in stone the actual scientists spend years to undercover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: what John Hammond and InGen created are theme park monsters. Nothing more, nothing less. The class clearly disagrees with his assessment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're saying you wouldn't want to study them if you had the chance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No force on this earth or in heaven could get me on that island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking through the cracked windshield of a junkyard plan see someone spray painting red circles on the outside of glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NASH, a wry, intelligent mercenary pilot and soldier, is painting huge eyes the windows of a wrecked plane. Finish tosses the paint can through the open windows and walks q away from the plane. We now see that RED TEETH are painted on the craft's nose looks absurdly like some angry beast. We are one the edge of a dry lake bed, part of an aircraf graveyard. Wrecked planes lie all around. We hear a phone RINGING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A RINGING satellite phone rests on a stack of gun cases. UDESKY, the leader of this crew, answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Udesky. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir. we're good to go. I'll lock it down as soon as you drop me the payment. With the phone still to his ear, Udesky wanders out of th craft...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Udesky looks over at Nash and COOPER, another mercenary. Cooper's the quiet muscle of the bunch, a weapons special finishes loading a massive gun, essentially a hand-cannon aimed at Nash's grimacing aircraft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, two of the very best I could find. No, I haven't worked with them personally, but they come with the highest recommendations. Then -- Cooper FIRES at the grimacing aircraft. A projectile rock into the plane and EXPLODES with a fireball. Nash and Cooper exchange a satisfied smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got nothing to worry about, sir. This is going to be a piece of cake. Pieces of the demolished craft come raining down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a man's hand, carefully scraping the stone away dinosaur fossil. We follow his hand back as he wipes off sweaty brow, revealing him to be BILLY BRENNAN, 25, an associate professor and site manager. He's a charmer. Looking past him, we see CHERYL, 21, a junior at junior o of a dozen COLLEGE STUDENTS working at the site, and the most smitten with her supervisor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy? I don't think I'm doing this right. He scoots over, lying down beside her. Checks her work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to go slowly. See, just take it little at a time. She's not listening, just watching his eyelashes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can never tell what's bone and what's rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Technically, it's all rock. The calcium in the bones is replaced during fossilization. But you can feel the difference. See? Rough, smooth. Rough, smooth. He runs her bare fingers over the two different patches, her. After a pause, she runs her finger along his stubbly chin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rough. ...and along his lips. CHERYL (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smooth. Billy may not have started this flirtation, but he's not it either. It's then that a

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW
dialogues.text: falls across them. Billy looks up to see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Grant! Grant has just returned, a bag over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Brennan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy takes one of Grant's bags, talking as they go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was your trip? Profitable?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be broke in four weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three weeks. I had to rent some equipment. The cross into one of the tents, which only has two "wall a dust-taped table, a dusty Macintosh is feeing data into strange machine the size of a dorm refrigerator. A mechan back and forth across a tray of fine sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You rented an automated litter box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a rapid prototyper. I feed in the scan data from the raptor skull, than the computer breaks it into thousands of slices which this thing prints, one layer on top of the other. It's the future of paleontology.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if it can't dig. The arm stops and suddenly the tray of sand shakes, dropp through holes in the bottom to reveal an object the size a person's fist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I give you a raptor's resonating chamber. Grant hates technology, but he can't help but be amazed b result. He lifts the strange object up, shaking out the remaining sand. Billy puts it to his lips and blows through it like a con The resulting SOUND is unique and piercing, the cry of an non-existent animal. Grant is speechless with excitement. uses it again and again, producing different SOUNDS and variations. In the distance, flocks of birds rise to the sky and fly Billy looks up to see a MAN and a WOMAN getting out of a Cadillac. Cheryl is pointing them in the direction of t tent. BILLY (cont'd)                                  (falsely casual)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I forgot to tell you. Some visitors wanted to come by and talk        to you. I  told them you'd be happy to see them.  maybe even have dinner with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Only now does Grant realize these two people Who were walking up to them. Putting on a friendly smile, Billy goes up to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Grant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (extending his hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul Kirby. Kirby Enterprises (reaching into his pocket)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My card. PAUL KIRBY is a talkative optimist with no "off" switch. His wife AMANDA KIRBY, just as friendly, is harder to read. There seems to be exhaustion behind her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I do for you, Mr. Kirby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well sir, I am a great admirer of yours, and I have an extremely interesting  proposition to discuss. Would you let my wife  and I take you to have dinner tonight? Our treat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I've been traveling and I'm very tired. Maybe some other time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guarantee it'll be worth your while. Behind Kirby, Bill furtively rubs his thumb and fingers together, indicating the guy is loaded. Grant musters a weak smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's be my pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They’re only halfway through the entree, but Grant is rea bolt. It's only Billy who's keeping him from being rude. over to Paul and Amanda’s table and sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First off let me say as a dinosaur enthusiasts, Amanda and I have admired your work for years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is truly, what’s the word? Inspiring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. It's everything Grant can do just to be polite. He desper wants to leave and get back to his dig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda and I, well, we just love the outdoors. Heck we've been on pretty much any adventure tour they can come up with: Galapagos, K2, the Nile...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We even have two seats reserved aboard the first commercial moon flight. Billy nudges Grant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, for our wedding anniversary this year we wanted to do something really special, something... He places his hand on his wife's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...once-in-a-lifetime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've arranged for a private airplane to take us flying over Isla Sorna. And we want you to be our guide. The Kirby's look to Grant as if they've offered him an am gift. But Grant just sighs and smooths the tablecloth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a very nice offer, Mr. Kirby, but I'm afraid I'm much to busy. If you like I can refer you to a number of highly qualified...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, see Dr. Grant, you're the best. You've seen these animals in the flesh. No one else has come close to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm flattered, but I've taken this little adventure tour. And with the air restrictions they've imposed after the incident in San Diego, you can’t fly low enough to see anything of interest. Paul is momentarily stymied, but Amanda rallies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, that's just the thing. Paul and I have special permission to fly low.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How low?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm no aviation specialist. But I do know it's hell of a lot lower than anyone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From what I understand, it's pretty much whatever we want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's hard to believe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just say that through my business -- imports/exports, emerging markets -- I've made some friends in high places. In this case, the Costa Rican government.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Grant, you don't know how important it is for us to have you come along. It would make all the difference. Grant is trying to find another way to say no, when Paul out his checkbook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And of course, we're prepared to make a sizeable contribution to your research here. Billy looks at Grant. Don't say no. PAUL (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can write all kinds of numbers on this check. Just tell me what exactly it would take. We HOLD ON a conflicted Dr. Alan Grant.

dialogues.speaker: NNNNNRRRRRRNNNNNRRRRR...
dialogues.text: A SMALL AIRPLANE - a Beechcraft Kingair 200 Turboprop, to exact - cruises through clear blue skies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant re-settles, trying to get comfortable. Billy is acr from him, finishing cleaning his camera lenses before put them back in the ragged case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even with what I pay you, you could get a better bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way. This is lucky. Couple years ago some buddies and I went hang gliding off these cliffs in New Zealand. Updraft sent me right into the side. BOOM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That does sound lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was this strap alone that saved my life. Got caught on a rock as I was falling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reverse-Darwinism. Survival of the most idiotic. Because he hasn't really said it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen Alan, I really appreciate you bringing me along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bones will be there when we get back. That's the nice thing about them. They never run away. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And besides, you got me into this. I don't intend to be alone with these people.

dialogues.speaker: ON PAUL AND AMANDA
dialogues.text: sitting near the front of the plane. Paul draws a long, n breath and looks at Amanda. She seems just as tense. Finally finding a comfortable position, Grant puts his ha his eyes, ready to take a nap. Done with his camera, Billy turns to someone just off scr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how do you know the Kirby's? and we reveal... Mercenary Cooper, the weapons specialist we met earlier. wearing sunglasses so dark you can't tell whether he's st at you or fast asleep. He doesn't answer. Did he even hear? And then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through our church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What Religion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh…the one that worships God and believes in being Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane continues onward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant slowly wakes in his chair, groggy. All the other passengers are fast asleep. Then Grant turns to his right

dialogues.speaker: A RAPTOR
dialogues.text: sits besides him. The dinosaur eyes him curiously, then o his mouth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan. And than it STRIKES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant wakes up with a start, disoriented. Billy is leanin him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan. We're almost there. The adrenaline still surging through him, Grant turns and THROUGH THE WINDOW. Clouds obscure the view, than parts reveal

dialogues.speaker: ISLA SORNA
dialogues.text: rising majestically out of the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We watch the plane descend sharply to the island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In various combinations, Grant and Billy, Paul and Amanda out the windows at the amazingly green island. Cooper looks out through a window of his own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we find the rest of the crew from the junkyard. Nash piloting. A VOICE comes over their radio headsets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Spanish accent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unidentified aircraft approaching Isla Sorna, this is San Juan approach. You are flying in restricted airspace. Immediately turn to the coordinates two-zero-zero. I repeat redirect to... A look from Nash then Udesky switches off the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane now descends to a mere hundred feet above the treetops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul puts his hand atop Amanda's as they stare intently o window. Billy looks to Grant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admit it. You're excited. Grant will admit nothing. Calling back from the cockpit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper! Yell up if you see anything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I thought I'd keep it to myself. Suddenly Grant spots...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There. There! An Apatosaur. Look at the coloration. EXT. ISLA SORNA – GRASSY FIELD – CONTINUOUS DAY An Apatosaur is grazing on the grass. INT.  PLANE – CONTINUOUS DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amazed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so use to seeing bones. It's weird to see skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. and Mrs. Kirby! If you look out the right you can see... But Paul just waves him away with a hand, staring intentl his window. We HOLD ON Grant a moment, thinking that odd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Udesky puts down his binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: South shore is clear. The rest is rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking out the window, Grant notices they're flying awfu low. Just then, he hears a MECHANICAL HUM and a LOW RUSH outside. Now wanting to believe --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not the landing gear? Paul, Amanda and Cooper don't respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you're... (realizing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't land. Paul turns back to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Grant if you'd just sit tight, we'll explain this all in a jiffy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This plane can not land!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going to be all right. Just... Grant is out of his seat, heading for the cockpit. He'll the controls if he has to. Cooper grabs him, pulling him back. Grant starts to strug but he's certainly no match. A well-practiced fist hits h dead on. CUT TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: OVER THE DARKNESS
dialogues.text: we hear Amanda's voice, strangely distant but amplified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric! Eric! Are you there honey? Ben! Erriccc! Her calls continue as we FADE UP to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRANT'S P.O.V. -- blurry and disorientated. He finds hims on the floor of the plane. Seeing him come to, Billy helps him slowly get up. Grant' is pounding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me we didn't land. By his expression, we see Billy would have to lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think they're looking for someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jungle has almost reclaimed this patchy vine-covered runway. The airplane is parked at one end. Nash, Udesky, and Cooper are checking their weapons. Amanda is at the edge of the tarmac calling into the jung BULLHORN. Billy and a groggy Grant emerge from the airplane. Paul t over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Grant, are you alright? I'm sorry we had to be so... The three mercenaries are now walking into the jungle wit their guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on? What are they doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing a perimeter. Making it safe. These guys are really good. One of them was a Green...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Kirby, trust me, on this island, there is no such thing as safe. We have to get back in this plane... Grant looks to Amanda, who shouts through a bull horn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on-bullhorn)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And tell your wife to stop making so much noise! We're food to these damn  animals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda, Honey! Dr. Grant says it's a bad idea!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the bullhorn)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing broadly at Alan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says it's a bad idea!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the bullhorn)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's a bad idea? As in on cue, there is a DEAFENING ROAR from the jungle. Everyone turns toward the sound and freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Alan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that? Grant doesn't answer, still listening to the reverberatio Then a couple shots are heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it a rex?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so. Billy and Paul breathe a small sign of relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds bigger. Nash and Udesky come RUNNING out of the jungle, headed fo the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta go, now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the problem? Can't you guys...? As Udesky and Nash sprint past Paul in interrupted by a second, closer, DEAFENING ROAR. He pales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Udesky waits by the door, hustling everyone inside. Nash hurries into the cockpit. Everyone scrambles to a seat. A climbs next to Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, honey. We'll circle around and come back. Udesky closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the other guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coop's a professional. He can handle himself. A blood-curdling SCREAM echoes through the jungle followe MACHINE GUN FIRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going! Udesky climbs into the copilot's seat, and Nash revs the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane starts down the runway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The passengers bounce in their seats as the plane picks u speed down the overgrown strip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, two hundred yards ahead of the plane,

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: emerges from the jungle. He stands in the middle of the r waving one arm wildly. His second, badly injured arm hang limp by his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Nash. Slow down, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nash spots Cooper, shoots a glance at the airspeed indica

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coop, you know I can't do it pal. He slams down full throttle in an attempt to reach flying Seeing that Nash has no intention of stopping, Paul shout the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? That's Mr. Cooper!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are looking down on Cooper from behind. As the plane approaches,

dialogues.speaker: A SHADOW
dialogues.text: falls over the injured mercenary. Then with brutal speed, ENORMOUS BEAST seizes him in its massive jaws and lifts h into the air. From this angle we get only a glimpse of a long crocodili snout, powerful clawed forearms and spiny sail rising fro creature's back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes are on the creature as it devours Cooper. Amanda away in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God! Paul, my God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking through the windshield, we see the creature is di in the path of the plane. Nash pulls back on the stick. The plane rises. The left propeller clips the flank of the enormous dinosaur, SNAPPING the blade. Blood sprays the windshield and side windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The turboprop banks into the jungle, out of control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The passengers are thrown about as the craft CRASHES thro trees, tearing off a wing and pieces of the tail. Finally coming to rest in the jungle canopy, the plane se in the trees. SILENCE. The passengers slowly recover and have a look around. Fol blocks most windows, making it impossible to see out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is anyone hurt? Checking themselves, everyone seems pretty much intact. Still thinking of himself as in charge...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet! We're okay. Let's everybody just stay put. He attempts to turn on the cockpit radio, but it's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's got the sat-phone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here! Paul hands the bulky phone up to Nash, who dials out. Grant unstraps himself, climbs to the back to the side do The door opens a few inches before hitting a branch. He looks out the and lets out a quiet gasp as the ground THIRTY FEET BELOW. He quickly shuts and latches the door. CLOSE ON the sat-phone. pressed against Nash's ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're sorry. All circuits are busy. Please try your call again later...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? What's the matter? Amanda SCREAMS. A huge reptilian face appears in the cockpit window. Ever else SCREAMS now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane LURCHES - and we hear a deep GROWL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The passengers hold tight, paralyzed. Nash buckles himsel his seat. Suddenly, the plane is YANKED from the side to side. Batt way and that, the terrified passengers tightly grip their seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, the horrible sounds of WRENCHING METAL as the no the plane is RIPPED RIGHT OFF. Nash and Udesky are suddenly sitting in open air. The nos the plane is tilting downwards, the jungle floor far belo The passengers hang almost vertically in their seats, Debris tumbles out the open end of the plane, some of it striking Nash in the head. Udesky unbuckles his seat belt and climbs back up into th cabin. Nash follows. Suddenly, a long snout with dagger-like teeth pushes past cockpit seats, opens wide, and

dialogues.speaker: CLAMPS DOWN
dialogues.text: on Nash's legs. The pilot CRIES OUT in agony. The others passengers grab his arms, trying to pull him back. But it's no use. The d rips Nash out of their grasp and down the aisle. Nash desperately grabs on to the seat cushion, then watch horror as the fabric RIPS AWAY. He's pulled out of the pl dropped to the ground. A giant foot steps in the way as t of the creature reaches down and quickly devourers the sc pilot. It's horrifying sight, but no one can turn away. Pleased with the appetizer, the creature comes back for t main course. Grant tries to force open the jammed rear door. Billy tri help, but the door won't budge. The dinosaur JAMS its snout into the fuselage and lunges Amanda in the first row. She yanks her legs back as the j SNAP SHUT. Behind Amanda, Billy reaches forward, UNSNAPS her seat be and pulls her into the next row back. The others unstrap their belts and crowd into the rear of passenger compartment. The shift in weight sends the fuselage tipping backwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane breaks free of the tree limbs and DROPS tail-fi the jungle floor. It SLAMS hard, then flips over onto its roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The passengers are prowled on the ceiling of the plane, d by the impact. Everyone is cut and bruised. Out of the open cockpit, they see two approaching dino fe A window near Amanda fogs over with condensation. when it clears, she finds herself looking right into enormous eye Then all hell breaks loose as the plane is SLAMMED across jungle clearing. The passengers are hammered against the walls of the plan tumbling like socks in a dryer. Debris, seats and luggage everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane comes to an abrupt halt as it SMASHES into a tr A gargantuan FOOT steps on the fuselage and FLATTENS it l paper tube.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside, windows EXPLODE, raining glass over the passenger the walls compress, Udesky becomes trapped in the rear of plane, the others in front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over here! Udesky dives into the narrowing gap, and Billy pulls him rest of the way through. Billy is as terrified as the rest of them, but he thrives this rush of adrenaline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then a huge CLAW digs into the skin of the fuselage and b to slowly PEEL the plane open. Grant looks up in dread at widening tear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way! Grant leads the group out the open end of the cockpit. Th make a mad dash for the jungle. A tremendous ROAR causes Billy to look behind him. He can help but steal a glimpse of this terrifying, but utterly fascinating, animal. Grant yanks him forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Grant in the lead, and Udesky taking up the rear, th tears through the jungle. Concealed by the dense undergrowth, the unseen dinosaur b down on them -- mowing down the young trees which TOPPLE around them. Grant spots a grove of

dialogues.speaker: HEAVIER TREES
dialogues.text: and leads the group into it. The dinosaur cannot fit between the trunks. It ROARS at the fleeing humans, searching desperately for a route aft them. The group continues their relentless pace, putting as muc distance as they can between themselves and the beast. Pa Kirby looks like he's about to have a heart attack. Even is gasping for air. They stop, thinking they've outrun it. Grant directs the group through some underbrush and into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our friends stop dead in their tracks. Amanda stifles a c Before them lies an immense unmoving SAUROPOD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. It's dead. Then a full-grown bull

dialogues.speaker: TYRANNOSAURUS
dialogues.text: rises up behind the carcass. It was feeding, its mouth mo with blood and carrion. Grant FREEZES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody move a muscle. Remember: the T-Rex tracks motion. Obeying, the group FREEZES for a few long beats. Then Ude takes off running. And T-Rex ROARS. Everyone runs. T-Rex is right behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dashing back the way they came, the group suddenly comes to face with -- THE FIRST MONSTER. We now get our first full unobstructed view of the gigant creature, SPINOSAURUS AEGYPTICUS. Over forty feet long an twenty-five feet high, the dinosaur has a bony sail along back. Its head is crocodilian with rows of long, curving Sinewy six foot arms terminate in three fingers hands wit fourteen inch claws. Nowhere else to run, the group scatters into the brush as two behemoth predators rush forward, their ROARS thundero Paul and Amanda scramble into one direction, Billy and Ud the other. But Grant can't go anywhere - his foot is stuc between two branches. He manages to free himself as the two dinosaurs approach. They'll have to deal with each other before eating the hu Grant dives down between two fallen trees as the Spinosau Rex circle one another like gladiators, each searching fo other's weakness. Laying flat on his back, Grant lets out a terrified GASP giant foot of Spinosaurus lands across the two trunks mer inches from his face. Spinosaurus lunges forward, powerful jaw open wide. T-Rex sidesteps the assault, its tail knocking down small trees as it spins out of the way. In the tress, Paul and Amanda scurry again for cover. Between the fallen trunks, Grant attempts to get away on hands and knees. T-Rex presses the attack, slamming its tail into the flan its adversary. Spinosaurus is knocked back, and Grant is forced to duck for cover. As Spinosaurus struggles to regain its balance, T-Rex div forward. Spinosaurus is driven backwards as T-Rex tries t grip its throat. Amanda yanks Paul out of their path. They Scramble over t Billy. Now on its side, Spinosaurus fights back ferociously. It at T-Rex with its long arms and razor sharp claws, then f kicks the animal with one mammoth foot. Tyrannosaurus staggers back, wounded. Down below, Grant is splashed by the blood pouring from t dinosaur, as he slowly makes his way towards his fellow h Spinosaurus lunges for the T-rex with gaping jaws and man topple T-Rex off its feet and sends the falling dinosaur ground. With an earth-shuttering CRASH, the dinosaur lands betwee Grant and the rest of the group. The companions scurry out of the way, but as they do so, head of the T-Rex now lands almost directly on top of the Plastered against an immense tree, the group watches in h as T-Rex starts to rise but is thrown back down as Spinos latches onto its throat. Spinosaurus crushes the life out of its adversary, and T- opens and closes its jaw a mere inches from our terrified friends. Finally, Grant reaches the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! Spinosaurus lets out a victorious HOWL, and the blood-dre professor leads the group through the undergrowth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winded from running, Paul is caught off-guard as a furiou Grant slams his back against a tree. Only one thing he wa know --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you bring us here? Paul is too startled to speak. Udesky tires to step in, b Grant gives him back a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our son is on this island. We need your help to find him. Still crunched against the tree, Paul pulls out a photo f shirt pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is him. Eric. He’s thirteen now. He's just about the greatest kid in the world. Letting go of Paul, Grant takes the photo, a Sears-style portrait of the boy we saw Parasailing at the beginning. shakes his head, disbelieving. He hands the photo to Bill The group splits into two sides -- Paul and Amanda, Grant Billy -- with Udesky stuck between. Dialogue overlaps in places.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's with a man named Ben Hildebrand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her new boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A friend. We were vacationing. Eric wanted to see the island and the dinosaurs, so Ben found a guy who would take them parasailing. They never came back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We called everyone, did everything we could. Because of all the controversy over this island, no one will step in. Costa Rica says it's a no-fly zone, it's their own damn fault. Guys at the U.S Embassy -- our U.S. Embassy -- said we should "accept the inevitable." You believe that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you hired these mercenaries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We prefer "recovery specialists." We do overseas custody issues and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you duped us into coming here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We needed somebody who knew the lay of the land. Somebody who'd been to this island before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disbelieving)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have never been on this island!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure you have. You wrote that book...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was Isla Nublar. This is Isla Sorna. The second island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low, to Udesky)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know, there were two islands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still, you have survived the dinosaurs before. You saved those kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few of us survived. A lot more died. And we were better prepared and better armed. (finally)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many days have they been missing? A look between Amanda and Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight weeks. Grand and Billy are speechless. It might as well be eight

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After what you've seen today, you really think your son could be alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's smart, Dr. Grant. And he knows so much about dinosaurs. Before anyone else can talk, Grant puts his hand out. He everyone to shut up while he plans their next move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm sorry, but no. We'll savage what we can from the plane. Then we head for the coast. There may be a boat left, something to get us off this island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Grant, we're not leaving without our son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can stick with us, or you can go and look for him. Either way you're probably not getting out of here alive. With that he leaves, A beat later, Billy follows. He has genuine sympathy for the Kirby's, but he's logical enough know Grant is right.

dialogues.speaker: BACK WITH PAUL AND AMANDA
dialogues.text: They look to Udesky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we do? Udesky is clearly at a loss, but for everyone's reassuran tries to mutter some brio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I think we should start searching for your son. In the direction they're going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent. They follow after Grant and Billy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The five survivors search through the wreckage, trying to anything useful. The task is grim. Mindful of Grant's  warnings, they move quickly and quietly. Udesky picks up a gun out of the swampy water. The barrel almost 90 degrees, unless. Billy finds his camera, intact. Digging a change of clothes out of his suitcase, Paul ste around the side of the plane to change. He's in his under before he notices Amanda is also there changing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing you haven't seen before. A beat. Amanda looks over as they get dressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much weight have you lost?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty, twenty-fire pounds. I've been swimming at the Y.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hate to swim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People change. A nod to mean, that's the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do you. They make brief eye contact, which Amanda breaks. Around the side, Billy is taking photos of a giant footpr dinosaur left in the mud during its attack on the plane. looks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would you classify it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obviously a superpredator. (best guess)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suchimimus. that snout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They never got that big.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baryonyx?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not with that sail. (Billy gives up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spinosaurus Aegypticus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember that on InGen's list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's because it wasn't on their list. Who knows what else they were up to? Billy looks past Grant to see Paul approaching. He's stru with the straps on his backpack. turning in circles. Billy regards him with suspicion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Mr. Kirby, tell me, when you climbed K2, did you base camp at 25- or 30,000 feet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty-thousand, I think. Closer to the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About a thousand feet above it, actually. (closer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most mountain-climbers remember how tall that mountains were. Paul knows he's caught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no Kirby Enterprises, is there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is. I own a place called Kirby Paint and Title Plus. We're out in the Westgate Shopping Center in Enid, Oklahoma. The "plus" is for bathroom fixtures, fireplaces accessories, patio furniture. Stuff like  that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't suppose that check you wrote us is any good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He paid us half up front. Cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mortgaged everything we had to do it. Even the store. and if we make it off this island with my son, I swear, I'll make good on the money I owe you. I don't care if it takes me the rest of my life. Grant and Udesky exchange a dubious glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: However long that is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda, Paul, Billy, Udesky and Grant walk through the ju

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loud whisper to Amanda)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop that. Dr. Grant says this is dangerous territory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well we should split up or something. We can cover twice the area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Dr. Grant says...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Grant says this, Dr. Grant says that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well what's the use of hiring an expert if your not going to listen to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because "Dr. Grant" isn't looking for Eric. Dr. Grant is looking for the coast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine...and when the Tricyclatops comes after you, don't come crying to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, don't worry about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just drop it Paul! The Kirby's conversation trails off into the jungle. Udes moves up next to Grant and Billy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they split up, I'm going with you. And as they continue forward, Billy spots something in th trees ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A parasail chute is caught in the branches of a tree. A y life vest hangs limply from a branch. Paul rushes over, unsnags it, and examines the label.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young adult.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Got something here. All turn to see Udesky holding up a camcorder encased in waterproof shell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Ben's! She grabs it from Udesky and pops open the housing. She t the power switch on the camcorder, but the battery's dead Udesky pull out a flashlight from his pack and looks to A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, give that to me. And as Udesky fiddles with the flashlight, Grant and Bill consider the parasail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks intact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should take it with us to signal any planes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I've got it. Udesky has rigged the wires on the flashlight so that the batteries can be used to power the camcorder. He brings a live wire to back of the camcorder. A red pow light comes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It works!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know for how long. Udesky swings the tiny screen out and pushes play. The ot crowd around.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SCREEEN
dialogues.text: Eric and Ben play frisbee on the beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's him. That’s Eric!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I filmed this the morning they left. Ben catches the frisbee, checks his watch and motions to Eric runs over, and Ben puts his arm around him as they r the camera. Paul reacts to this image but holds his tongue.

dialogues.speaker: THE VIDEO SCREEN -
dialogues.text: The image now CUTS to a shot from aboard Enrique's boat speeding towards ISLA SORNA -- the start of the movie. Er points excitedly at the island and smiles at the camera. We replay the opening moments of the movie from Ben and E perspective, soaring high until...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unclip the line!

dialogues.speaker: THE JUNGLE -
dialogues.text: A PAN from face to face of all watching this tape with a mixture of hope and nausea.

dialogues.speaker: ON SCREEN -
dialogues.text: Angle again with Ben's legs in the foreground. Falling fa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hand on! Hang on buddy! Now the camera penetrates the jungle canopy and the pictu and sound become complete chaos: SCREAMS from the both, branches BREAKING, flashes of Ben and Eric's frightened f as the camera is buffeted in all directions. With a lurch the terrifying descent in finally over, and jungle floor is just ten feet away, swaying back and fort beneath Ben and Eric's feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ok, buddy? There's GURGLING to his voice. Ben may be more hurt than letting on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through his sobs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're okay. It's going to be okay. Here, get ready. I'm going to unhook you. The sound of PUMPLING is followed by the sight of Eric DR into the frame, landing on the ground rolling. He stands looks back up at Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm all right

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weaker)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to get out of this, pal. And on that, the power and picture fade away. BACK ON PAUL AND AMANDA - overjoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? He's okay. He's alive! Everything's going to be all right now. Amanda brings a hand to her mouth, silently nodding her h Grant and Billy exchange a dubious look, than begin pulli parasail out of the tree. As they do so, the sail gets ca a branch. They pull harder. The branch bends, but the sail won't co loose. One last tug and than, SNAP. The branch breaks, th falls away to reveal… A SKELETON. It swings down directly at Amanda. She SCREAMS. Finally, the others are able to pull her away. As they un the lines, the men are able to get the first view of the of Ben Hillenbrand, still caught in his harness. Amanda's knees buckle. Regaining her balance, she runs of the jungle. Paul quickly follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reeling, Amanda comes to a stop in an area with thick undergrowth. It's danger here, very still and quiet. She tries to calm herself, but each effort to suppress ju makes her more emotional. She's surprised as Paul wraps a around her to comfort her. But she doesn't fight it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry Amanda. I am. And I'm sorry for the things I said about him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you liked Ben. I had no right to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frustrated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s not about him. It's Eric. He's alone out here somewhere. Our baby is all alone. Saying it aloud, the reality sinks in for both of them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I was hoping that with Ben around, there'd be someone to keep him safe. Checking in on clients, Udesky stops at the edge of the thicket. Something raises the hairs on the back of his ne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Grant! He nods for the others to take a look at this. They head Grant at the rear. As he approaches, Billy is packing up the rest of the chu backpack. He stops short from what he sees. Looking down, we CIRCLE across the jungle floor. Here we strange, hollowed-out construction made of sod and branch Maybe six feet around. Just now noticing the others' stare, Paul looks down into of the bowls at his feet, a half-buried nest. It's filled football-sized eggs, laid in a spiral. And this isn't the only nest. Amanda counts twelve in all out in an oddly symmetrical pattern. The last to arrive, Grant identifies the species in a hor instant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raptors. And as he says the words, off in the distance, we hear the cry of some herbivores, around by the chorus of snarls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party blasts through the forest, trying to keep up wi Grant. They haven't even had time to ask --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Paul)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What’s a raptor? Paul has no idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't look that big. I mean, comparatively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we came across one, we might live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you never came across just one. From the back --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! Where's Billy? They all stop. The only one not there is -- Grant

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy! Billy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost sotto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we weren't suppose to yell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here! He comes in from the left. Excited, he explains to Grant

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got some great pictures of the nest. You know this proves raptors raised their young in colonies. Furious with his student. Grant just keeps moving. There' time to stand around and argue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This speaks to a larger social structure, the possibility of Darwinian altruism. It changes everything. A beat. Trying not to sound presumptuous --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could co-write a paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah yes, the first rule of academics. Publish or perish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Much fatigued, the five now mach upward towards a crest. Panting and flushed, they reach the top of the ridge and into the distance. A jungle valley stretches before them. Not far off in A V COMPOUND - comprised of several buildings. One building a seems to cover several acres. The weary group breathes a sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet there's a very good chance Eric's in there. I'd bet my bottom dollar. Udesky and Grant share dubious looks and continue down in the valley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group emerges from the jungles and enters the compoun They walk through an overgrown parking lot, littered with abandoned vehicles. Some are lying on their side. Others overturned completely. They're not going to be driving anywhere. A troubled Grant peers through a windshield, partially ca in, like some giant head butted the glass. (Think back to World) And the group finally approaches the front doors of an enormous building. As they head up the front steps, we se something in the distance behind them:

dialogues.speaker: CAT-LIKE MOVEMENTS
dialogues.text: on the high ridge. To fast to see what it was. But too om to dismiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our friends now find themselves in a sparse, one quietly opulent corporate lobby now in the process of being recla by the jungle/ Roots and ivy poke through the floor and w In the waiting area, the cushions of a sofas and chairs h gnawed at and pulled apart. Dusty coffee mugs and filled ashtrays lie on the table. The water has turned brackish near by cooler. Sudden FLAPPING. We look up and see BIRDS nesting in the rafters. It is an eerie, haunted place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric! Are you here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric! All listen for a response. Nothing. Paul and Amanda excha despondent look. Sitting on the reception counter is an official-looking telephone. Everyone has the same thought, but no one dare Finally -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell. Amanda puts the receiver to her ear. Nada. With Grant in the lead, they head deeper into the buildin Unseen by the group, a fleeting SHADOW flits across the l dirty windows with terrifying speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple vending machines stand at the one end of this lo hallway covered with vines. Paul notices them and pulls change from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see. I've got about a dollar seventy- five. How about you guys? Billy SMASHES IN the window of one machine with his boot. Picking through the glass, he pulls out some candy bars a chips. He checks the expiration date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God for preservatives. He tosses the food to the others. Paul now turns to his own vending machine and SMASHES it his heal. The glass refuses to break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant and Billy push through a set of doors to see

dialogues.speaker: A CAVERNOUS HATCHING FACILITY
dialogues.text: filled with much of the same equipment we recognized from first island, although the sheer size of this place dwarf of the facilities seen previously. As the group walks down the ramp and onto the floor, they absorb the incredible array of technology: enormous cryon freezer, their plug pulled years ago; empty incubators; t of formaldehyde with dinosaur fetuses and body parts. Machines with intricate tubing and wing arms stand beside conveyer belts cris crossing the room at different levels

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is how you make dinosaurs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is how you play God. Billy looks around the lab. He can't help but be impresse

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay if I take pictures? Grant nods. Billy sets his lucky camera back down on the worktable. T from now, astute observers of the DVD will not that Billy doesn't actually take his camera from the bag; he was car it because there wasn't any room inside. Billy pulls a new roll of film from the bag and zips it s

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE LAB
dialogues.text: Amanda is passing a large cylindrical tanks with half-for embryos floating in formaldehyde -- genetic experiments g awry. Finally she reaches

dialogues.speaker: A GIGANTIC MANIFIED RAPTOR HEAD
dialogues.text: floating in the one tank. Something about this specimen catches Amanda’s attention. bends forward, getting very close to the glass. She peers into the eyes of the nightmarish creature. Then --

dialogues.speaker: AN ACTUAL RAPTOR
dialogues.text: lunges at her form behind the tank. She SCREAMS. Fortunately the raptor can't get between the closely spac tanks. Amanda runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back out! Move! And as the group races through the lab the Raptors find a larger gap between the tanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul leads the way, checking the door for possible escape routes or hiding places. Twenty feet behind,

dialogues.speaker: THE RAPTOR
dialogues.text: rounds a corner, bolting after them. Paul ducks in the cl door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group slams the door behind them and quickly takes in room. There are several rows of oversized steel cages, apparent used for containing young dinosaurs. Many of the cage doo standing open. The group races down a lone aisle. Close behind, the rapt BURSTS into the room, ROARS. As the Raptor gains ground, Udesky and Billy run into one open cages, SLAMMING the door behind them. Grant, Paul and Amanda duck into another. Before they can swing the cage door shut behind them, however, the raptor into it, driving the door into the cage. They are forced back against a chain-like wall, trapped i small triangle space by the advancing door. The angry Raptor is now inches away through the cage door. Then, suddenly, the raptor looks up. We follow its gaze. of their triangular enclose is wide open. The eager raptor climbs up the chain-like door. Catching tail of an idea, Amanda grabs the door and nods to the ot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Push! They push hard on the cage door, swinging it and the rapt right through the opening of the cage. Now the raptor is trapped in a small triangular space, th going right to the ceiling. Amanda slides the door's bolt through the chain like wall temporarily trapping the dinosaur. The raptor struggles desperately, GRAWLING AND SNARLING, the cage door seems to be holding. As everyone rushes back to the door. The raptor begins to make a LOW, HAUNTING MOAN. As the others head for the door, Grant lingers a step, li to the beast's simple melodic cry. It has the same tones came from the model resonating chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's calling for help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group exits the rear of the lab building and finds it a large equipment yard. The CALL of the raptor is still a as they head for the tree line. Now they moan is ANSWERED from distant jungle quarters. The responses quickly MULTIPLY. To the group's dismay, th soon find themselves virtually SURROUNDED by raptor CRIES distant and near. Grant looks around with amazement. It's vindication of hi theory on raptor communication, but it couldn't come at a time. Responding to the growls, a herd of grazing HADROSAURS su flees across the open space. Then, in the distance behind herd

dialogues.speaker: A PACK OF RAPTORS
dialogues.text: emerges from the jungles, coming their way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Head for the trees! From the lab building, the raptor we left imprisoned now out one of the doors and HOWLS to the pack -- the same cr heard in the lab. The raptor pack moves into the hunting formation. One ALP RAPTOR. slightly larger than the others, leads the charge middle. Grant risks a looks back. But doesn't stop running. GRANT (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: THIS WAY
dialogues.text: In an effort to escape the oncoming raptors, Grant leads group right into the stampeding heard of hadrosaurs. Suddenly, all is chaos. Hadrosaurs race past, splitting u group. Letting the others get ahead of him, Grant looks back. Mu his dismay, the raptors are ignoring the hadrosaurs. Indeed, the pack weaves its way through the herd -- the r only want them. In the chaos of the stampede, everyone loses sight of eac Up ahead, Billy trips and falls. As he rolls the strap on camera bag breaks. He doesn't notice it's missing until h already back on his feet and running. Amanda and Paul keep close to each other. Further back, G spots Billy's fallen camera back. He grabs it as he runs Looking back, Billy sees that Grant now has his back...

dialogues.speaker: KEEP GOING
dialogues.text: They lose sight of each other in the rush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the hadrosaurs WHIP PAST, Paul and Amanda climb up int tree. A raptor leaps at Paul, barely missing his leg. Trying to pull Paul up, Amanda nearly loses her balance. time, Paul catchers her. Billy climbs up a nearby tree of his own in sight of Paul Udesky has nearly reached a tree of his own when he finds himself

dialogues.speaker: HEADED OFF
dialogues.text: by a raptor. He turns to the other way, but finds THERE ARE MORE RAPTORS. He picks up a fallen branch as these dinosaurs cautiously approach. Not more than a few feet away, the leader of th stops, peering at him. Udesky swings hard, but the dinosaurs feints. From behind another raptor slashes at the back of his legs, severing muscles. Udesky CRIES OUT and drops to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TREETOPS
dialogues.text: Paul, Amanda and Billy can hear him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Udesky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Listening)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's this way. From here, the thick branches overlap, forming a kind of "second floor" above the ground. It's not easy, but you c from branch to branch, tree to tree.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE FLOOR
dialogues.text: Unable to walk, Udesky attempts to crawl away from the an The effort clearly causes him great pain. Strangely, the raptors suddenly don't seem interested in him anymore. Rather, they're "talking" among themselves. Udesky is ama find him self still alive. Suddenly, one of the raptors SLASHES at him again. But it delicately not a mortal blow, just a very painful one. Ud CRIES OUT, louder this time.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TREES
dialogues.text: Hearing the new cry, Paul, Amanda and Billy move faster, finally seeing Udesky on the ground. He's face-down, bare moving but still MOANING. The raptors are gone. In the lead, Amanda starts to climb down. But Paul grabs holds her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to help him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right. A predator wouldn't leave a kill wounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not a kill, he's still alive. She breaks from Paul's grip and drops to the ground. She' a foot away from the tree when

dialogues.speaker: ALL FOUR RAPTORS
dialogues.text: lead out from their hiding places. They almost catch her Billy and Paul pull her back up on the limb The raptors stare up at them, angry their plan didn't wor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They couldn’t climb up, so they were trying to get us to come down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They set a trap (amazed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They actually set a trap. Bored with waiting, the raptors go back to finish off Ude making a meal out of it. Up in the branches, the survivor horrified and sickened. Then, from the deep in the forest, a new RAPTOR CRY. The raptors look up, listening, then suddenly run off into th jungle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Grant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Climbing higher in a tree, Grant is just feet above a gro pack of raptors. He scales one branch, the next, finally reaching a perch that the dinosaurs can't jump to.

dialogues.speaker: LOOKING DOWN
dialogues.text: The entire pack is now standing still, watching him. In t center, the Alpha Male lets out a sort of BARK. Respondin cry, the other raptors CALL BACK. As terrified as he is, he can't help but be fascinated by communication. Like a hellish bird song, there's a rhythm a structure. They're clearly talking about something. Under his breath, Grant is able to mimic its patterns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean? What are you saying? Of course they can't answer. They just keep using the sam "phrase." Ready to ditch Billy's camera bag in order to climb highe he's had to hold it by the strap -- Grant finds his hand with a runny slime. He looks down at the camera bag, and the source. It's oozing out the bottom. He unzips the bag to find

dialogues.speaker: A BROKEN RAPTOR EGG
dialogues.text: inside, the white and green yolk still dripping from the of the shell. There's another intact egg beside it. This is what the raptors where chasing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God damn you, Billy. Ever the scientist, Dr. Grant tests a theory even in the danger: he holds up the intact egg so that the raptors ca They suddenly go crazy, howling the same phrase but LOUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means, "Give us the egg," doesn't it? "We want the egg." He gently drops the bag to the ground. Although the rapto interested, pulling out the unbroken egg, they're still b placated. The song may have changed, but they still want dead. They begin to jump at him, eventually, hopping up on each other’s backs. It's only a matter of time till they reach Grant moves to climb higher, but sees no branches he can And than he hears the low CREAKING. A CRACK. The branch h on is starting to give in. He looks down at the face of his enemies, knowing he'll b their next meal. And then,

dialogues.speaker: A SMALL CANISTER
dialogues.text: lands at the base of the trees, immediately SPRAYING out cloud of oily fog. It's the first of

dialogues.speaker: FIVE CANISTERS
dialogues.text: that land in the area, creating a thick cloud. It's not j smoke though something far more caustic. As it hits the raptors they immediately recoil, those clo to the canisters SHRIEKING in pain. Tumbling in the dirt. There may be a pheremonal element to the mist as well -- seem panicked, disoriented. Pack mentality takes over, and after the first ten raptor off running, so do the rest, some tripping over their fee blindly. This may be dino-tear gas, but it's not good for humans e Up in the tree, Grant's eyes immediately burn from the va He squints to see through the fog, where he spots

dialogues.speaker: A HUMAN SHAPE
dialogues.text: at the edge of the smoke

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! They'll be back! Grant half-climbs, half-falls out of the tree, rushing to through the heaviest of the smoke.

dialogues.speaker: A SMALL DIRTY HAND
dialogues.text: grabs his, pulling him along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eyes swollen from the gas. Grant stumbles, barely able to the other person pulls him along. It's only now we can id his rescuer as

dialogues.speaker: ERIC KIRBY,
dialogues.text: the boy he was brought to rescue. A lot has changed in th eight weeks. It's not just dirt and muck -- he's the filt child you've ever seen -- something primal has come out i Something wild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the far side of the tipped over vehicle, Eric pulls op hatch -- his hiding place. The door opens part way. Eric motions for Grant to follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squeezing in sideways -- it's very tight fit -- Grant fin himself in a space no bigger than the inside of a Datsun. a small battery-powered lantern. This is where Eric has b hiding. The minute Grant's inside, Eric goes back to work re-seal the door. This 13-year old boy has become astonishingly efficient at staying alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric... The boy holds up a hand. He listens for a moment. He does hear anything outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric, your parents are both here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Costa Rica?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the island. Eric truly can't believe it. He hoped to be rescued but..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll never make it. I mean, they can't manage when the cable goes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd be surprised what people can do when they have too. Eric studies his guest, finally certain he recognizes him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Alan Grant, aren't you? (off surprised reaction)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I read both of your books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one do you prefer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first one. Before you where on the island. You liked dinosaurs back then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back then, they hadn't tried to eat me. Grant takes a better look around Eric's tiny hideaway, impressed with what he's been able to scavenge. Among the items we see another smoke canister, some battery-powered lanterns and lots of candy wrappers. This kid's been livi chocolate for weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When InGen cleared out, they left a lot of stuff behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any weapons, radios? Eric pulls up a long cattle prod to show Grant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Found this, but the battery's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a wonder you aren't. I'm amazed, Eric. I  barely lasted 30 hours. You lasted eight weeks. The line catches Eric strangely. It's the first moment of emotion we've seen him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
