dialogues.text: Is that all it's been? I thought it was longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to be positive)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The important thing is we both made it. That's something we have in common. Eric rips into a candy bar. After a moment, he realizes h should offer one to his guest as well. Grant takes it. A lone beat. Than, Grant just has to know

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you read Malcolm's book?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno. I mean, it was kind of preachy. Chaos-this, chaos-that. And like, to me, the guy seemed kind of high on himself. Grant smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's two things we have in common.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trio is where we left them, perched up in the branche They're far from safe, but nothing's after them for a while. In Billy's eyes, we can see a storm of guilt raging. But hasn't said anything. Won't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't just stop looking. Eric and Dr. Grant are out there somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to find them too, but we can't do a bit of good right now. For every scary thing we saw in the daylight, I'll bet there ten times more of 'em at night. (to Billy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were an expert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Grant was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well Dr. Grant isn't here, so we're going to have to figure out what to do ourselves. Amanda is impressed by her own determinations. A long bea AMANDA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do we do? No one has the faintest clue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VARIOUS SHOTS; The creatures of Isla Sorna walk past in t shadows, some looking up at the light in the trees. Suddenly, one of the creatures is attacked by another. We ROLLING, SNARLING, HISSING, just seeing the outline of th fight. Just as fast as it began, the fight is over, the w snakes on the loser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone's moved to different branches, trying to settle the night. Paul keeps looking over to the tearful Amanda, to say something. He finally does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want you know, Amanda. It's not your fault what happened. Amanda looks over, not sure what his absolution. PAUL (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric has always been headstrong, and you throw Ben Hildebrand into the mix and well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well damn it. I don't speak ill of the dead. What I'm trying to say is, it’s was just a crazy accident. The exact same thing could have happened if he was with me. You can't go beating yourself up about it. Realizing he's trying his best, Amanda can’t stay angry w him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This wouldn't happen if he was with you. I mean, you drive five miles below the speed limit. I totaled three cars in fives years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That one time was just the bumper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He would have been, safe. Completely, entirely, suffocatingly safe. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would have him to see more of the world than Enid, Oklahoma. I wanted to see more of the world than Enid, Oklahoma. And so yes, it's my fault that this happened. I'm sorry that you have to be here. Really looking at her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sorry at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning on Isla Sorna. A low mist hangs tight to the fore floor as Eric seals up his hideaway for hopefully the las They start walking. Eric pulls something out of his pocke shows it off to Grant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know what this is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A raptor claw. I use to have one. A fossil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mine's new. Grant hands it back. Eric is becoming more and more a normal thirteen-year old There's an innocence to him that's coming back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much of this island have you explored?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I stayed pretty close to the compound, Figured if anyone came to look for me, that's where they'd start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to head for the coast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closer you get to the water, the bigger things get.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy and Amanda wait for Paul as he comes out of the bus hiking up his shorts. Trying to take charge...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to stick to the plan. Head for the coast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Eric and Dr. Grant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going to the coast was Alan's idea. If he's alive, that’s where he's headed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Eric? Billy represses his instinct to say Eric's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rationalizing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's probably has a better chance by the coast as it is. Figures that all the big dinosaurs would live in the center of the island. (to Billy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Grant and Eric walk, both stop, hearing a strange soun for a change, it's not an ominous one. It's a human one. A phone is RINGING, very faintly. Without a word to each Grant and Eric decide its coming from the right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul is picking the briars out of his socks as they hike, risking tripping on every step. Then Amanda stops short. the first to hear it: THE SAME RINGING. After a beat, everyone else can hear it too. And recongni finally lights on Paul's face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My phone. Suddenly, Paul frantically searches his pockets as the ot anxiously watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had the phone the whole time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I don't have it with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did you have it last?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think. And Paul wracks his memory...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane. I got a call on the plane, put it in my coat pocket, and... Bust suddenly, he stops, his face is lighting with an awf realization. Amanda couldn’t bear the wait...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?...WHAT!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I loaned it to Nash. He must have had it on him when he... The hideous implication of his words slowly sink in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still following the faint RINGING, Grant and Eric turn to

dialogues.speaker: A SAIL
dialogues.text: moving through the low trees. We recognize it as the back spinosaurus. We might think it's any random spinosaurus, except for the RINGING coming from somewhere inside it. Grant and Eric press back against a tree, keep perfectly still as they hear the THOOOOMB, THOOOOMB, THOOOMB of the creature's footsteps reverberating. It's tail RUSTKES aga the brush. It's moving behind them, and it's close. We hear the RINGING move from left to right as it passes. far, its has no idea they're there. Looking across the clearing, Eric is startled to see

dialogues.speaker: PAUL AND AMANDA
dialogues.text: are no more than 20 yards away, also hiding. An involunta reflex, Eric calls out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mon! Dad! Grant immediately covers the boy’s mouth. But it's to lat The dinosaur has stopped. We still can't see it. We don't close it is. Paul and Amanda spot Eric with Grant. They're a thousand emotions at once: relieved, disbelieving, terrified, over They want to run to him, to yell out to him, but the mons close. Grant takes his hand off Eric's mouth. They both stay completely silent. All this time, the sat-phone is RINGING. Than it stops. And after an agonizing beat, the beast moves. At first we not sure which direction it's headed, but finally we can its moving away. Once the sail is finally out of sight, Eric breaks from G hold and dashes to his parents' arms. They coop him up. H him, kiss him, their affection unquenchable. He's crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reassuring him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweetheart, you're okay. (reassuring herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're okay. (disbelieving)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never had a doubt. Never did. Us Kirby men, we stick around, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We do. Looking at her grubby son, Amanda licks her shirttail, tr to rub his face clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, there's not enough spit in the world for that. She LAUGHS. It's the first times she's laughed in two mon Billy crosses the distance to Grant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to keep moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan, I want to tell you that I'm so sorry about the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy, I can't talk to you now. He walks off. Billy follows him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, okay? Just yell at me. Call me an idiot. An asshole. Stupid. Tell me I screwed up because I know I did. Grant doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought if we could get a raptor back to the mainland, we could get serious money for it. Enough to fund the digging for 10 years. More. Whatever it took. Grant shakes his head, disgusted, But doesn't stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to believe me. I did it with the best intentions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally turning on him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of the worst things imaginable have been done with the best intentions. You rushed in with no thought to the consequences, to yourself or anyone else. (finally)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're no better than the people who built this place. Grant keeps walking, leaving Billy with his guilt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group enters a structure with giant windows designed look into the canyon beyond -- only there's nothing to se thick fog. Toward the center of the room, a spiral staircase that le a lower level. With Billy lagging, Grant approaches the stairs and peers the circular opening in the floor. There is not much to s fog, a glint of sunlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step by step, Grant leads the group down a rusty spiral staircase below the observation room. The stairs end in a level. Although we're technically outside, this whole pla strangely enclosed. There's a thick fog at this level -- clouds, really -- bu below we can see the river. And at its banks, a barge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We climb down to the barge and follow the river out to the ocean. With any luck, the Costa Rican coast guard will pick us up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we go home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we go home. Grant leads everyone down a RAMP to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A catwalk branches off, a SET OF STAIRS continuing down t along the canyon wall. Grant starts down the stairs. He's only taken a few steps the rusty staircase suddenly BREAKS BENEATH HIS FEET. Paul grabs him in the nick of time. The staircase vanish the fog. CLANFING AGAINST the canyon wall. After a few mo seconds of silence, they hear the CRASH far below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay? Grant nods and looks in the other direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about if we try this way? Their only other option is a precarious catwalk that disappears into the mist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think it goes all the way across?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One way to find out. The only way to get his-near-fall is to push ahead. But h stomach turns at being so high. Amanda follows. The catwalk creaks and groans, listing slightly. She freezes mid-stride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glancing back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd better do this one at a time. Amanda steps of and Grant carefully pushes forward, disappearing into the thick fog. The others listen to the CREAKING of the catwalk until it ABRIPTLY. SILENCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Grant? More silence. Then, out of the fog, a distant voice call

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on over. One at a time. Amanda steps tentatively forwards. Eric is clinging to he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric, its okay. You'll be right behind me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not going anywhere, I promise. As Paul holds Eric, and Amanda shares a look. Amanda

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all together now, Eric. Eric reluctantly releases her mother. Amanda starts to cr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant has stopped at a lateral support across the catwalk, trying to get the sense of where they are and wh purpose this place may have served. Seeing that the support beams are brace high arched walls mesh, it becomes obvious that we are inside this vast construction. Amanda emerges from the mist and turns back to the catwal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay! Come on, Eric!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric is next to go across. He's still tentative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout if I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I can do it. Billy and Paul look on as Eric disappears into the vapor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muttering to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it Eric. Nice and easy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric slowly gropes his way forward. He feels a GUST OF WI a HEAVY THUD ahead on the catwalk which now sways beneath him. Regaining his balance, Eric peers forward, but the fog pr him from seeing more than fifteen feet ahead. There is an SILENCE. Eric calls out timidly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the canyon, Grant moves across the later support. his hand on the railing, he sends a white, hardened subst dropping into the mist. Looking up, Grant notices a large strut, covered with the substance. Realizing what it could be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bird cage. Then, the sound of Eric SCREAMING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric watches as A LOOMING SHAPE emerges from the fog -- a nightmarish vision stalking purposefully forward.

dialogues.speaker: A FULL GROWN PTERANODON,
dialogues.text: standing over seven feet high, walks upright on clawed fe thirty foot wings folded bat-like at his side. The creature sees Eric and fixes him with a demonic glare Eric CRIES OUT and dashes back down the teetering catwalk The Pteranodon ruses to its feet, spreads its thirty-foot and flies directly at him.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE OTHER END OF THE CATWALK
dialogues.text: Hearing Eric's SCREAMS, Paul charges onto the catwalk, searching in the fog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't hold! Suddenly,

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: emerges from the fog, racing toward his father. And then

dialogues.speaker: THE PTERANODON
dialogues.text: swoops out of the fog, opens its giant rear claws, and sn the terrified boy from the catwalk. Paul Kirby watches in stunned, abject horror as the Ptera carries Eric directly overhead --

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: The flying reptile struggles with the boy's weight. Paul watches helplessly as Eric is carried high across the can Paul runs back alone the catwalk in a desperate attempt t Eric in sight. Billy stays behind, moving back up the platform to try to keep the dinosaur in view. With a new idea, he races back stairs to the observation room. He has a way to save Eric When he reaches the canyon wall, Paul turns a corner and along another enclosed catwalk leading deeper into the ca Grant and Amanda now come pounding down the catwalk tryin catch up with Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul! Where is he? Can you see him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying! That thing took him down this way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Split up!

dialogues.speaker: THE PTERANODON
dialogues.text: carries Eric deeper into the canyon. The creature's wings steadily overhead, and the WIND is fierce. Eric looks dow sees the river far below. The Pteranodon swoops over an isolated outcropping of roc the end of the canyon and drops Eric into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large bowl of mud and branches the size of a satellite Eric lands right on top of a pile of dinosaur bones picke clean. Mixed among is one human skull. Before Eric has time to cry out, he looks up to find

dialogues.speaker: SIX PTERANODON HATCHLINGS
dialogues.text: closing in on him with sharp-edged beaks. He picks up the human skull and whips it to the hatchling They easily duck it and keep coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant looks up to see Billy leaning out over the edge of observation platform. He suddenly realizes what Billy is to do.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Billy SHOUTS BACK, an excited-terrified grin on his face.

dialogues.speaker: I KNOW THE CONSEQUENCES
dialogues.text: Billy jumps off the railing and DROPS TOWARDS THE CANYON BELOW. Grant, Paul and Amanda watch as Billy FALLS past them lik stone, plummeting towards certain death. But then --

dialogues.speaker: THE PARASAIL CHUTE
dialogues.text: blossoms above him. Not only does it slows Billy's descent, but he even manag catch an updraft and begin to rise. He struggles to control the parasail, swooping dangerousl close to the canyon wall, barely avoiding it. Up ahead he catches sight of Eric and steers towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric struggles to keep away from the hatchlings. But ther no way out of this nest. Billy SWOOPS overhead, but he's too high to reach Eric.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: He circles around to make another attempt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul rounds the corner and finally catches sight of Eric nest, some fifty feet below, fighting off the hatchlings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on, Eric! Paul sees an outcropping he could jump onto from here. It big leap, though, he might not make it. He steels himself the jump, then chickens out. Grant and Amanda come up behind him. Suddenly,

dialogues.speaker: A SECOND PTERANODON
dialogues.text: CRASH LANDS on the catwalk enclosure about them -- right to a gaping hole in the mesh. The catwalk GROANS with the extra weight. The pteranodon JAMS its head through the hole, SNAPPING a them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy circles, making his approach. In the nest, Eric kicks at the hatchlings, but they're undeterred. Billy and Eric will only have one chance. As Billy swoops past, Eric jumps and grabs onto his boot. yanked up and out of the nest. But than, MOTHER PTERANODO shoots past, tearing out a piece of the parasail in its b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pteranodon who landed on the top of the catwalk conti SNAP through the hole in the enclosure. Finally the reptile's massive weight proves to much, and entire section of the catwalk BREAKS FREE of the canyon w and FLIPS OVER LATERALLY. Amanda, Grant and Paul are able to hang on, but so is the pteranodon, who now climbs their way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His parasail badly damaged, Billy tries to keep aloft. He as low as he dares, he yells to Eric --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go! Terrified, Eric falls into the river safely. He surfaces, immediately swimming to shore. Trying to gain altitude, Billy bends hard to the right. B rigging is too badly damaged. He flies right into the can wall, hitting hard. Instead of tumbling down to the river, he finds himself swinging from his harness - the parasail snagged on a roc spire above him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, Grant and Amanda struggle to stay away from the pteranodon as it moves towards them. Suddenly. the far end of this inverted section of catwalk detaches from the canyon wall and SWINGS DOWNWARD. The force of the action sends the three tumbling directly towards the pteranodon. Miraculously, they manage to avoid its open beak. But the are all sent plummeting toward the river below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hit the water hard, resurfacing moments later. The current is carrying them downstream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two pteranodons who were pursuing Billy now land on n ledges and consider how best to dispatch their prey. Billy frantically tries to unhook his harness, but the te is so tight from his own weight that he can't loosen the buckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul and Amanda emerge from the water by the canyon wall find their son hiding behind a rock, searching the skies Billy. Amanda takes Eric tightly in her arms, and Paul urges the keep moving. Up ahead, the mesh of the aviary meets the r Wading the shore, Grant now scans the canyon, searching f Billy. It doesn't take long to spot him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy continues to struggle with the harness but to no av The doomed young man is suspended high up on the canyon w like a modern Prometheus, an entire FLOCK of pteranodons gathering around him preparing to peck away his liver. An everything else. A MAMMOTH PTERANADON has landed beside him and looks him straight in the eye. The gigantic creature lunges at him. Billy dodges away as he can. The pteranodon's frustrated bite severs a crucial juncture on Billy's harness, and Billy is able to wriggle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric, Amanda, Paul and Grant watch in amazement as Billy last to PLUNGE DOWN into the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He made it! Billy bobs to the surface and spots the group downstream. waves and begins to swim towards them. Soon he nears the and gets to his feet, wading as he comes. Grant, Paul, Amanda and Eric hurry to meet him. Grant is overjoyed to see him alive. But his smile quickl fades as he sees

dialogues.speaker: THE ENTIRE FLOCK OF PTERANODONS
dialogues.text: diving down from above in angry pursuit of their lost pre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy, look out! Billy glances behind him. He races forward, motioning fro companions to turn around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back! Get back! Just then Billy is knocked down by the lead pteranodon. I strikes from behind with a brutal, calculated beak to the Billy stumbles and falls to the ground. Grant rushes forward with Paul right after him. Amanda ta Eric to safety down river. Billy SCREAMS as the ENTIRE FLOCK of pteranodons now swar around him, picking him apart with their beaks and claws.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no use, Dr. Grant. No use. Grant can't take his eyes off Billy, whose BLOOD stains t water rushing by. And now several pteranodons are heading their way. Diffic as it is to leave Billy behind, Grant and Paul make a run Just as the pteranodons are about to swoop in for the kil and Paul dive back into the river...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and resurfaces on the far side of the mesh aviary wall for air. Just behind them, the mammoth

dialogues.speaker: PTERANODON
dialogues.text: CRASHES into the mesh. It tears at the steel, actually ri it in one place. At the dock up ahead, Amanda and Eric have found a rusty, waterlogged barge that's somehow still floating. Carrying tarp-covered cage, the boat was meant for transporting di up and down the river. Amanda pushes them away from the dock as Alan and Paul cl on board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The current takes the craft downstream, letting us get ou first good look at the incredible

dialogues.speaker: AVIARY.
dialogues.text: It's a vast, domed mesh structure that spans the entire c In all, a feat of remarkable engineering and unmistakable hubris. Catching their breath, our four survivors look at the cag were caught in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yanking the starter rope one final time, Paul finally get engine to turn over, PUTTERING along. Amanda is beside hi bailing water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My own kid was right in front of me and I didn't do a damn thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You couldn't have made that jump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should have tried. It should have been me on that beach back there, not Billy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would you have helped Eric? (he can't answer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He needs you, Paul. He needs us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He could have died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he didn't. And neither did you. And I'm glad about that.

dialogues.speaker: 99A UP ON THE BOW
dialogues.text: Grant is beside Eric, keeping watch, but also feeling the of Billy's death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Although I've studied them in the wild. Eric looks over, not sure what that means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a theory that there's two kinds of boys. Those who want to be astronomers and those who want to be astronauts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to be an astronaut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, I was the opposite. I never understood why anyone would want to go into space. It's so dangerous. You do one thing wrong and you're dead. The astronomer -- or the paleontologist -- get to study these amazing things from a place of complete safety. And truthfully, everything you really need to learn, you can learn it from the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then you never get to go in space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. The difference between imagining how things might be and seeing how they really are. To be able to touch them. That's what Billy wanted to do. The barge starts to round a bend. On the bow, Grant and E are the fist to see something remarkable. Eric GASPS, unprepared. We don't know yet what they see. GRANT (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can blame the people who made this island. But I can't blame the people who want to see it. To study it. At the rear of the barge, Paul just now sees what's ahead struck, he slows the motor and motions for Amanda to take look. And so do we.

dialogues.speaker: UP AHEAD
dialogues.text: The setting sun illuminates an incredible valley filled w dinosaurs. We see armored ANKYLOSAURS with clubbed tails. Duck-billed CORYTHOSAURS. We float under the gigan arching necks of eighty-foot BRACHIOSAURS. With the mist from the river and the play of light, we're witnessing a kind of primal Eden. GRANT (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's a boy suppose to resist this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FULL MOON passes behind clouds. THUNDER quietly rumbles LIGHTNING flickers in the distance. Paul is still at the wheel. The river is narrower here, a cautions must be taken to avoid the banks. As the barge begins to round another bend. a FAMILIAR HIG PITCHED SOUND pierces the darkness. Muffled but unmistaka it is the RINGING SAT-PHONE. All exchange looks of sheer PANIC, expecting Spinosaurus leap out at any moment. Grant scans the river banks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep quiet. Paul cuts the motor, and time seems to stop as the four s posed for action. The barge finishes rounding the curve, and the ringing gr LOUDER. The suspense is excruciating until finally... Their eyes widen at some horrifying sight, more horrifyin than anything they've yet seen. SEVEN MOUNDS OF DINOSAUR DUNG sit on the patch off treele ground just beyond the river bank. As our friends consider the sight, an idea comes to them almost simultaneously. With Eric still in the boat, Amanda, Paul, and Alan jump the river and rush to the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three companions sprint towards the source of the RIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find it before it stops ringing! And bracing themselves and hocking their breath, they PLU their arms into their respective dung-heaps. After a few moments of this disgusting search...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got something. I think I've got something! All turn to Paul. Clearing away the clinging defecation, holds up to a beeper. And still the phone RINGS. Returning to their bleak task, they shovel the excrement their arms. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got it! I've got it! Grant snatches the RINGING SAT-PHONE from Amanda's hands, presses a button, and puts it to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too can own a time share in beautiful Guadalajara. Enjoy a meal in one of our four star restaurants, explore our coral reefs, or just walk on the beach... The Kirby’s hear the recorded voice and let out a collect heavy sigh. Grant shuts off the phone. In all the excitement, none of them notice a fierce horne CARNOTAUR right behind them. The giant creature ROARS, re to eat them. But as it gets in close, it smells them. Even a dinosaur eat something that is covered in shit. After a beat, the Carnotaur turns and walks away, back into the jungle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't help but be a little offended.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON the cleaned satellite phone's display. The batte level indicator is FLASHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you do, don't call the U.S. Embassy. They won't do a God Damn thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we don't exactly have a Costa Rican phone book here, so it will have to be somebody we know in the states. Someone we can absolutely count on to send help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Amanda)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't trust Stan with a snowball in a blizzard. Paul glares at her. Now Eric notices something odd in the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that? The others look down in the murky water. Just below the surface,

dialogues.speaker: A SHIMMERING WAVE OF SILVER
dialogues.text: passes beneath the boat. Then a SINGLE FISH jumps from the water. And another. And another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bonitas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something must've scared them. Another roll of THUNDER, this time much closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the motor going. Paul moves the motor and pulls the start cord. The engine sputters but won't come to life. And now the phone BEEPS. The battery is getting even weak Grant makes a quick decision and DIALS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you calling? But Grant ignores the question. RING. RING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pick up! Pick up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wearing his jammies, three-year old Charlie awkwardly pic the phone with both hands. He has the mouthpiece next to lips, but the earpiece is hanging out in space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hewwo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Recognizing who it must be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie? Charlie. Get your mother. Right away! A long silence. Charlie bites his lip, looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie? Are you there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hewwo? The sat-phone BEEPS again, this time much LOUDER. Amanda and Eric watch Grant, realizing their fate may han this single call. Paul struggles without success to start motor. Then, unseen by the group, a

dialogues.speaker: GIGANTIC FIN
dialogues.text: rises from the water just fifty yards from the barge. It' headed right to them and closing fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperate)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie! It's the dinosaur man! Go get mommy, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Not sure what to do with the phone, Charlie makes a logic choice and hangs it back up. He walks away to his mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant realizes he's been cut off. He's about to redial wh

dialogues.speaker: WHAM
dialogues.text: The barge is RAMMED, sending everyone tumbling. Grant man to stay on top of the wheelhouse, but he loses grip on th phone, which falls on deck.

dialogues.speaker: SPINOSAURUS
dialogues.text: rises from the water, towering over the barge. As lightni FLASHES and thunder CRACKS, the dinosaur lets out an ear- splitting ROAR. It lunges at Grant with gaping jaws. Grant leaps out of the way just in time as the dinosaur

dialogues.speaker: RIPS OFF
dialogues.text: the entire wheelhouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie leads Ellie into the room. Hands her the phone. O course, it's just a DIAL TONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was somebody on the phone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinosaur man. Ellie looks at him with confusion, then quickly checks th Caller ID box besides the phone. It's international, and number she recognizes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant stays one step ahead of the Spinosaurus as the beas apart the quickly-sinking boat. It spits out the wheelhouse and bites down on the stern o boat, ripping off a chunk. Grant is heading up to the other three when he hears the phone RING.  He spots it, just about to fall into the wat Dives for it, answering...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan? She can hear the Spinosaurus ROAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan? Alan! But he's cut off by a SECOND ROAR, the sound of someone SCREAMING. And then the line goes dead. Ellie pales. Charlie looks at her with a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (imitating)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raaaar!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dropping the dead phone, Grant scrambles towards the fron the boat and joins Paul, Amanda and Eric, who have taken in the dinosaur cage. The fearsome beast now lifts the stern of the boat clear the water. The cage SCRAPES across the deck and SLAMS into the gunwa toppling off the barge and INTO THE RIVER. Grant and the Kirby’s are still inside.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The cage sinks. The closest to the door, Paul manages to The other three aren't as lucky. The cage rotates as it d and lands on the river bottom with the door side down, tr them inside. In the cold murky depths, they pull frantically on the ba Debris and equipment float around them. Paul surfaces out of the breath and disoriented. Spinosau pushes past the boat. If anyone is going to save his fami has to be him. And so he dives. Pushing with all his might, he manages to tip the heavy structure, just enough so Amanda, Eric and Grant can get Paul himself isn't so lucky. Spinosaurus grabs the cage and Paul, throwing both straig out of the water. Paul flies twenty feet away, further fr shore.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Spinosaurus is going after the heroic Mr. Kirby, who dive swimming underwater. He's trying to lead it away from his family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up! Up! He points to a heavy crane assembly, designed for lifting off the large boats. Now well accustomed to fleeing on command, Amanda sends Eric up first, climbing the scaffol like a jungle gym. All the while, they're trying to spot Paul. Grant is the last to climb, reaching the first section as Spinosaurus returns from the water, SLAMMING into the bas the crane. The whole assembly SHUDDERS, threatening to ri the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hold on. Try as it might, the beast can't climb the crane. So inst RAMS it, SHAKES it, trying to knock them off. Eric slips, Amanda catches him. About to shed his bag to climb higher, Grant finds one la hope. It's the resonation chamber model. A beat before he decides: It may not be the best choice, but it's the only He blows through it, the same EERIE PITCH we heard before the third try, he's able to approximate the "egg" cry he the raptors give. He keeps it up, repeating over and over Spinosaurus stops for a beat, confused How this sound cou coming from a non-raptor. But then keeps SMASHING. We can hear the mounting bolts STRAIN. Soon the whole cra will tip. But not before a MATCHING CRY is heard in the jungle. Gra stops, not certain he heard it. But there it is AGAIN. He keeps blowing. The crane is close to tipping when a single RAPTOR appear from the darkness, CHIRP-BARKING at the Spinosaur, who si bats away. But then MORE RAPTORS come. And even MORE. Soon there are dozens gathering, circling. Grant stops signaling. All three survivors watch with horrified fascination, knowing their fate is perilous no which side wins. Looking at his adversaries, Spinosaurus ROARS. And sudden the raptors attack. Spinosaurus easily handles the first few, but like ants t just keep coming. They climb up his back, slicing, into h their razor-sharp claws.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jump! Swim for the far shore! All three drop from the crane arm into the water. Meanwhile, the fight continues. Spinosaurus rallies, shak off many of the raptors, but they just keep coming. Their hooked claws dig in, scraping the meat to the bone. Spinosaurus puts up a brave fight to the end, but finally collapses, dead. The raptors continue to shred it to ribb Then one of the raptors looks over to see the survivors swimming away. But a bird in the hand is worth two in the bush. It goes its meal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant is trying to move them along. still headed downstre But Eric won't budge another foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to keep looking for Dad. We have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I know. I want to look for him too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: then we should... She kneels down, facing him. She's just as upset as he is motherhood carries the burden of remaining calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me tell you a few things about you Dad, okay? He's very very very clever, very very brave, and he loves you ever very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He loves you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. He loves us very very much. And I know that right now more than anything, your Dad would want to know that we're safe. Okay? Eric nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to get out of this, and everything's going to be all right, I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to your mother. Out of the darkness steps Paul Kirby. Amanda is knocked o with surprise. Eric runs to him, nearly tackling him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good thing I've been swimming, huh? Amanda hugs him and Eric so tightly they can't breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The foursome sit back on the wide beach, one facing each direction, keeping watch. A light rain is falling, b don't seem to notice. Trying to keep his boy's spirit up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember when we went fishing last summer? And I was trying to put the boat in and the trailer sank? And then the tow truck came and tried to pull it out, but it got dragged in? And the truck driver threatened to knock your Dad's lights out? So I said I was the governor and he believed me? Eric really smiles, remembering the day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Amanda is smiling too. She had completely forgotten the incident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a fun day. To Paul, after some consideration....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should try fishing again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do. It's worth another shot. And who knows? Things might turn out differently. Her hand takes his, gently brushing off the wet sand, fin touching. It's a small thing, but it's a start. Sensing his cue to leave, Grant gets up and starts walkin the beach. Eric hurries to follow him. He speaks conspiratorially, not wanting to alarm his parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lady you called, how do you know she can help us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's the one person I could always count on. And she's saved me more times than she realizes. I owe her everything. A long beat as they walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's strikes me now I never told her that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. As they keep walking, Grant notices something rammed agai the rocks ahead. It's a speedboat, its hull ripped open f impact. And it's not just any boat either -- it's the same Dino-S boat that was pulling the parasail. Eric hasn’t seen it y Grant stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric, do you know what happened to the boat? that brought you here? Why did it crash?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I couldn't see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do me a favor. Go back to your parents for a minute, would you? (pre-empting objections)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look worried. Eric nods and heads back to Paul and Amanda. Grant forges approaching the speedboat wreckage. He doesn't know what find, but he needs to look. Almost reaching his parents, Eric stops. Looks out over t ocean, where he sees TWO LIGHTS. He doesn't say anything for a moment, trying to make sure they're real. They are. And they're coming closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom! Dad! They look up to see the distant lights, just now making o full forms...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helicopters. Helicopters! He SHOUTS with joy. Paul, Amanda and Eric wave their arms making as much motion as possible. The helicopters -- big military choppers -- change direction, heading straight f them. Paul and Amanda embrace, then kiss, the moment getting th of them

dialogues.speaker: AT THE SPEEDBOAT
dialogues.text: Grant looks in, prepared to see anything in the wreckage. the cabin is surprisingly intact, just a little blood. Th three gashes on the driver's seat back. Grant measures th spacing with his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Grant! Helicopters are coming! Grant looks down to the wet sand around him, finding a tr three-toed tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're safe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No we're not. THE FIRST CHOPPER. flies right overhead. Paul and Amanda are confused, until second helicopter starts to land -- the first on is there cover them. Grant YELLS at the first chopper, trying to wave it away. the noise of the blades is DEAFENDING.

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: At the treeline, the upper branches are shaking. At first looks like it's just the wind off the chopper, but something more is happening.

dialogues.speaker: A PTERANODON
dialogues.text: flies up out of the trees, the first of twenty. It's a go and terrifying sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrified, the Costa Rican CHOPPER PILOT veers away, but pteranodons are already on him. They SMASH at the windows grabbing on the skids, The chopper rolls wildly. One over-eager pteranodon sticks his head up to high, get decapitated by the blade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the second chopper touches down on the beach, Eric, Am and Paul load in. Grant is running their way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, the first copper is losing the battle even as climbs higher. The helicopter suddenly tips, falling, SMA into the trees with a massive fireball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeing the explosion, the SECOND CHOPPER PILOT takes off. Amanda and Paul are on board, but Grant is still running The helicopter passes right over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the pilot)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to go back! We can't leave him! Seeing a ladder release by the door, Paul throws the leve and-steel-ladder unfurls, dragging across the sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant chases after us, catching a rung just as it goes ov water. Behind him, pteranodons are circling the wreckage the first chopper and starting to go after the second. Buffeted by the wind, Grant climbs the ladder up towards chopper. A pteranodon flies up right behind him, trying t bite. It catches Grant's shoulder. Grant spins to the far side of the ladder. The pteranodon to bite him again, but finds it head caught between the r As it tries to free itself, it just gets more entangled. The entire ladder starts to lift, caught by the updraft f creature’s wings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up with the pilot, Amanda sees the other pteranodons are back to the island, unable to keep up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not following. In back, Paul and Eric get the ladder mechanism to begin retract. It reels Grant in faster. It also reels in the pteranodon, which may be caught, but is still plenty dang As Grant reaches the cabin, they shut off the ladder engi The pteranodon is still working its way free, pulling its and closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting over the noise)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to cut it! Find something sharp! Everyone checking the cabin for a knife, anything sharp. Finally, Eric hands Grant the raptor claw. Grant uses it to rip the line. The fibers break and fray, the pteranodon keeps coming closer. Paul throws a wrench at the pteranodon, WHACKING it strai in the head. It felt good, and damn if it didn't slow it little. Grant has cut through the cord. He started on the second the pteranodon SNAPS at him, going for his hand. There's nowhere for Grant to cut without the pteranodon getting h And idea, Grant very deliberately places in his hand on t pulling away at the last moment. The pteranodon itself bi through the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pteranodon falls away from the helicopter, catching w just before it hits the water. It circles and flies back to Isla Sorna. As horrifying as the creature was a moment ago, it's sudd beautiful again. Each motion of its giant wings is a smal symphony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting between his parents, Eric looks back at the islan the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think is going to happen with the dinosaurs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The population will Stabilize eventually. They'll adapt to fit different roles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either that, or the government will firebomb it back to the Stone Age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would completely support that.

dialogues.speaker: ON ERIC AND GRANT
dialogues.text: looking back at the island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope they don't. I want to come back someday. And Dr. Grant realizes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do I. EXT. OCEAN – DAWN The helicopter flies away across the ocean, leaving the i
